    • Constructor Detail

      • HPActor

        public HPActor​(Team team,
               int hitpoints,
               edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.userInterface.MessageRenderer m,
               HPWorld world)
        Constructor for the HPActor.

        The constructor initializes the actions list of this HPActor.

        By default,

        • All HPActors can be attacked.
        • Have their symbol set to '@'
        Parameters:
        team - to which this HPActor belongs to
        hitpoints - initial hitpoints of this HPActor to start with
        m - message renderer for this HPActor to display messages
        world - the World to which HPActor belongs to
        See Also:
        team, hitpoints, world, Attack

        See Also:

      • getTeam

        public Team getTeam()
        Returns the team to which this HPActor belongs to.

        Useful in comparing the teams different HPActor belong to.

        Returns:
        the team of this HPActor
        See Also:
        team

      • getActions

        public java.util.ArrayList<HPActionInterface> getActions()
        Returns an ArrayList containing this Actor's available Actions, including the Affordances of items that the Actor is holding.
        Overrides:
        getActions in class edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Actor<HPActionInterface>
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing this Actor's Actions

      • getItemCarried

        public HPEntityInterface getItemCarried()
        Returns the item carried by this HPActor.

        This method only returns the reference of the item carried and does not remove the item held from this HPActor.

        If this HPActor is not carrying an item this method will return null.

        Returns:
        the item carried by this HPActor or null if no item is held by this HPActor
        See Also:
        itemCarried

      • setTeam

        public void setTeam​(Team team)
        Sets the team of this HPActor to a new team team.

        Useful when the HPActor's team needs to change dynamically during the simulation. For example, a bite from an evil actor makes a good actor bad.

        Parameters:
        team - the new team of this HPActor
        See Also:
        team

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage​(int damage)
        Method insists damage on this HPActor by reducing a certain amount of damage from this HPActor's hitpoints
        Specified by:
        takeDamage in interface HPEntityInterface
        Parameters:
        damage - the amount of hitpoints to be reduced

      • setItemCarried

        public void setItemCarried​(HPEntityInterface target)
        Assigns this HPActor's itemCarried to a new item target

        This method will replace items already held by the HPActor with the target. A null target would signify that this HPActor is not carrying an item anymore.

        Parameters:
        target - the new item to be set as item carried
        See Also:
        itemCarried

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns true if this HPActor is dead, false otherwise.

        A HPActor is dead when it's hitpoints are less than or equal to zero (0)

        Returns:
        true if and only if this HPActor is dead, false otherwise
        See Also:
        hitpoints

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol()
        Description copied from interface: HPEntityInterface
        Returns a string symbol that represents this HPEntity or HPActor.

        The Views use this method to obtain the symbols that are used to query for resources(images) and for display.

        Specified by:
        getSymbol in interface HPEntityInterface
        Returns:
        a String representing the HPEntity or HPActor.
        See Also:
        HPGridTextInterface

      • setSymbol

        public void setSymbol​(java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from interface: HPEntityInterface
        Sets the symbol of this HPEntity or HPActor with a new string string.

        Although not a must the new symbol is preferably,

        • single character
        • unique for each HPEntity or HPActor

        The Views use this method to obtain the symbols that are used to query for resources(images) and for display.

        Specified by:
        setSymbol in interface HPEntityInterface
        Parameters:
        s - a string to represent this HPEntity or HPActor

      • isHumanControlled

        public boolean isHumanControlled()
        Returns if or not this HPActor is human controlled.

        Human controlled HPActors' HPActions are selected by the user as commands from the Views.

        Returns:
        true if the HPActor is controlled by a human, false otherwise
        See Also:
        humanControlled

      • hasCapability

        public boolean hasCapability​(Capability c)
        Description copied from interface: HPEntityInterface
        Returns true if this HPEntity or HPActor has the given capability c, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        hasCapability in interface HPEntityInterface
        Parameters:
        c - the Capability to search for
        Returns:
        true if this Capability c is manifested, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Capability

      • resetMoveCommands

        public void resetMoveCommands​(edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.space.Location loc)
        This method will poll this HPActor's current Location loc to find potential exits, and replaces all the instances of Move in this HPActor's command set with Moves to the new exits.

        This method doesn't affect other non-movement actions in this HPActor's command set.

        Parameters:
        loc - this HPActor's location
